page.title: 18Local Emergency Services
page.content: The police station at Sanquhar is a part of the Dumfries & Galloway Constabulary, and it's manned by 7 full-time police officers. The local inspector is also responsible for the police stations at Thornhill and Kirkconnel, these statons being run by the sergeant. The full-time policemen can be augmented by a number of Special Constables who are called out when special conditions prevail. The local Fire Service is a volunteer group retained and trained by Fire Brigade headquarters 26 miles away in Dumfries. In emergencies the firemen are alerted by a special alarm system and they turn out the appliance within minutes of being alerted. People charged with minor offences may be tried in the local Justice of the Peace court - more serious crimes are dealt with in Dumfries Sheriff Court.
